job_description:
A Marketing Manager supports the Director of Marketing (DOM) in all Marketing Planning & Execution strategies for the hotel. Assists in the development, management, execution and measurement of all aspects of the marketing/branding strategies under the leadership of the Director of Marketing; including but not limited to Marketing Budgets, Social Media, Websites, Digital & Print Advertising, Collateral, Video/Photography Assets, etc. that maximizes exposure in order to achieve budget, increase revenue, and market share targets.

The position may also act as a liaison between the hotel and regional marketing support, outside agencies and contracted vendors/service providers. Requires extensive and regular interaction with hotel’s Director of Marketing & eCommerce.

Keys to Success:

1. Builds a close alignment with on-property, regional, and brand marketing teams.

2. Successfully executes the tactical elements of the annual marketing plan.

3. Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects at once.

4. Has a passion for learning and staying on the cutting edge of new digital strategies, trends and technologies.

5. Highly adaptable to seasonality and conflicting priorities.

What will I be doing?

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Marketing Planning & Strategy

· Branding & Positioning: Supports in the execution of all messaging, positioning and marketing strategies. Helps deliver content that meets brand standards.

· Plan & Budget: Supports in the development of strategic marketing plans under the leadership of the Director of Marketing. Marketing plans should be annual, monthly and by segment of deployment inclusive of cost, deployment strategies (print, digital, and/or social media) through the review of competitive data, demand analysis and market mix management.

· Agency Point of Contact: May be responsible as the day-to-day agency point of contact to ensure execution of plan.
• Internal Partnerships: May work/liaison with internal corporate partners, including but not limited to Brand, Destination, and ECG.

Tactical Marketing Execution & Analysis

· eCommerce: Executes eCommerce campaigns to support the hotel strategic marketing plans working within the established budgets. This includes (but is not limited to) email, paid media, social media, online listings, and SEO/SEM. Tracks and analyzes success of marketing campaigns and works with the Director of Marketing & eCommerce to adjust marketing strategies/budgets where needed based on performance metrics.

· Project Management: Manages the development of creative (in coordination with an agency where applicable) for all marketing initiatives, ensures timely media placement and coordination of production/materials deadlines, in addition to, project expense management.

· Website Content: Manages Brand.com and vanity website (Where applicable) content, including upkeep of images, special offers, landing pages and other site content enhancements and requirements. Responsible for ensuring all legal and security requirements are maintained on the vanity site.

· Collateral Development & Upkeep: Reviewing and approving all on-property/in-room collateral, sales collateral, sales tools, and sales offer ensuring alignment with brand standards and brand and hotel-level positioning.

· Third Party Site Management: Maintains all imagery and content within 3rd party sites, including but not limited to: Expedia, Booking.com, TripAdvisor, and all Social Media websites.

· Content & Asset Management: Identifies visual asset needs and coordinates all photo & video shoots as needed.

· Reporting: Pulls ad-hoc reports requested by leadership to assist with ownership and/or corporate meetings.

Meetings, Presentations and Reports

· Assist the Director of Marketing in preparation for all strategic meetings, including weekly and/or monthly hotel executive committee meetings, ownership reviews and corporate hotel reviews.

· Prepares marketing activity reports on regular cadence and on an as needed basis.

SUPPORTIVE FUNCTIONS:

· Provides analysis to Director of Marketing where necessary to support the development of the annual business plan and on-going measurements.

· Performs special projects and other responsibilities as assigned and participates in task forces, committees and cluster groups as requested.

· Participates where appropriate in related trade/business related functions, events, conferences and workshops.

What are we looking for?

SPECIFIC JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY

· Extensive knowledge of marketing communication mediums to include but not limited to digital advertising, eCommerce, and social media.

· Ability to perform critical analysis and to manage extensive amounts of information

· Excellent written skills sufficient to produce internal/external sales and marketing communication

· Excellent presentation skills

· Ability to effectively deal with department heads, executive committee members, team members and corporate staff.

· Ability to manage projects effectively – ability to manage multiple projects, meet and work effectively under time and resource constraints

· Copywriting

· Software/Program Skills/Knowledge:

□ Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point, Excel & Outlook)

□ Social Sites and other applications

□ CMS

□ Digital analytics

QUALIFICATION STANDARDS

Education:

· High School Diploma required

· Four year college degree required.

o Emphasis in marketing and/or public relations preferred

Experience:

· Minimum of 2-5 years combined marketing, advertising, and/or ecommerce marketing experience.

· Prior hotel/travel industry experience preferred

Grooming:

· All employees must maintain a neat, clean and well-groomed appearance (specific standards available).

job_description:
LATAM Field Marketing Manager

Why We Have This Role

Qualtrics continues to grow the field of Experience Management, bringing insights and actions to customers across the globe. To support our mission, we’re looking for someone who can take ownership of the Latino America Region, develop a strong marketing strategy, and execute a plan with unique experiences and field events that drive demand and revenue. This marketer will closely partner with marketing counterparts as well as the regional enterprise sales team and sales development representatives on field events and account-based marketing initiatives to create a steady stream of pipeline across multiple product lines and industries.

How You’ll Find Success
• As an individual contributor, self-motivation, with the ability to work autonomously and communicate across teams, is key to finding success
• Must have strategic acumen and execution skills, and a deep understanding of personalization, creating memorable experiences through events, demand generation, and revenue attribution.
• Strong attention to detail, project management and organization skills with the ability to independently manage multiple initiatives at once
• Innovative; ability to bring new ideas and provide fresh perspectives on current field processes
• Results-oriented with experience using qualitative and quantitative metrics with a focus on revenue, conversion, sales, and other marketing goals
• Exceptional stakeholder management and interpersonal skills required.

How You’ll Grow

By joining Qualtrics, you become part of a team that dares to pursue groundbreaking experiences. Our mission is to build technology that positively impacts businesses and makes them more human.
• As a member of our global field marketing organization, you will join a diverse and inclusive community that values the voice of each individual. We strive for representation that reflects the world we live in and goes beyond it.
• You will have the opportunity to be a part of a team that upholds values such as transparency, whole-hearted commitment, customer obsession, unity, and resourcefulness.
• Your responsibilities will include developing a robust marketing strategy and executing plans with unique experiences, programs, and campaigns designed to drive demand and revenue for the LATAM region.
• We encourage big-picture thinking and foster an environment that embraces innovation and creativity. You will have the freedom to flex your strategic and tactical skills, all within a fast-paced and high-growth setting.

Things You’ll Do
• Own planning, strategic vision and execution of Latino America regional field marketing plans that create new opportunities, build executive relationships, and impact revenue growth
• Strong understanding, experience and passion of events (online and offline), demand generation and revenue attribution.
• Think creatively and generate ideas to build robust, unique 1:1 and 1:Few events  
• Partner with fellow field and ABM marketers, as well as sales and broader marketing counterparts to develop and deliver high-touch marketing programs that support multiple products and industries
• Create, execute, monitor a comprehensive follow-up strategy for each campaign and event
• Support the regional sales leads on logistics and execution for virtual and in-person event programs such as roundtables, meetups, workshops, executive dinners, etc.
• Work cross-functionally with SDRs, sales, product, growth and digital marketing, customer success and many others to execute region-specific marketing plans
• Work with Marketing and Revenue Ops teams to manage measurement of every program and its impact through Tableau reporting; evaluate event/campaign ROI, ensure department consistency in reporting, and present recommendations for improvement
• Maintain weekly KPI and ROI reporting and dashboards for review across all events and campaigns
• Manage and maintain invoicing process and accounting for events to ensure consistent tracking across all regions
• Travel to select regions to provide onsite support for events as needed

What We’re Looking For On YourResume
• 7+ years previous marketing experience; including at least 4 years within the Latinoamerican region, planning and coordinating field events and creating marketing plans to execute in different countries
• Bachelor's degree, with preference for Marketing, Business or equivalent
• Proven experience on end-to-end ownership of B2B marketing and events role (enterprise software, SaaS, regional marketing a plus) in environments with Sales Executives, and Customer Executives
• Hands on experience co-developing strategic account plans with Sales for Enterprise Software accounts
• Excellent copywriting skills and attention to detail for promotional emails, invitations and other event related materials
• Knowledge of Salesforce, On24, Coda, Qualtrics and other event management software preferred
• Fluent in English and Spanish, portuguese is a plus

What You Should Know About This Team

We are a dynamic and adventurous marketing team, unafraid to push boundaries and achieve remarkable results.
• Though small in number, our team is agile and fiercely determined.
• Data serves as a foundation for our decision-making process, but our true passion lies in exploring new ideas and introducing groundbreaking concepts to our global network.
• Challenges excite us, as we view them as opportunities for growth and positive transformation.
• We are not merely observers of change; we actively initiate and drive it.

Our Team’s Favorite Perks And Benefits
• Work-life integration: frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours
• Qualtrics Experience Program: MXN 36,882 annually (eligible after a year)
• Wellness reimbursement: MXN 25,000 annually
• Allowances for meals, transportation, groceries, and more
• We believe in sharing Qualtrics' success which is part of the compensation for all employees

Qualtrics Work Experience

As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 3 days per week in the office together and 2 days from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment.

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

​​​​

Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.

The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model: Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.

job_description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.

Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home!
• *About the team**

Handy is Angi's direct to consumer brand and is seeking a Marketing Manager to own and allocate the Social Media Marketing budget for the Handy brand. In this role, you will own the allocation of marketing spend across all social media channels as well as some smaller, alternative channels.

This is a cross-functional role that will work closely with a range of departments and partners both internally and externally (in Product, Finance, Operations, Engineering, Customer Experience and Legal), solving diverse and challenging problems with our product. From identifying, sizing, and executing growth opportunities, to overseeing projects that will improve the customer experience, you will be responsible for Handy's continued growth while also ensuring that customers have a best-in-class service experience through our retail partners.

As a Marketing Manager, you will be a key member of Handy's team, responsible for developing and executing a strategy that advances Handy's mission "to seamlessly deliver every service to every home," while developing as a future leader of the organization.
- We are looking for someone who is located in Mexico and is bilingual in English and Spanish._
• *What you'll do**
- Allocate budget across all channels (and within channels) to maximize return on ad spend (ROAS) and improve consumer lifetime value
- Balance strategic acumen with analytical ability to identify and execute growth opportunities in a fast-paced environment
- Develop test plans to measure the performance of acquisition strategies and inform optimizations and future tests
- Own analyses that provides actionable insight into business metrics, issues, and business opportunities; develop and execute plans to realize these opportunities
- Work closely with internal teams and Handy's external partners to ideate ways to drive continuous growth while also improving customer experience
- Dive deep into qualitative and quantitative data to pinpoint opportunities; work closely with Operations, Finance, Product and Engineering teams to implement changes throughout the tech stack
- Prepare clear, concise presentations that summarize findings and recommendations from strategic projects and present findings to internal and external stakeholders on a weekly basis
- Conduct strategic projects around market and user research
• *Who you are**
- 4+ years of professional experience with evidence of increasing responsibility including in marketing roles.
- Experience owning 6+ figure marketing budget
- Bachelor's degree
- Strong quantitative skills and aptitude. High proficiency with excel required
- Strong communication skills and eye for detail. This role requires the ability to create informative documents and present them directly to Leadership at Angi and to external partners
- Creative problem-solver with excitement to work on cross-functional teams and projects
• *We value diversity**

We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.
• *Compensation & Benefits**
- Compensation offered may vary based upon factors such as experience, location, and exchange rate.
- This position comes with competitive benefits including health insurance, flexible time off, and more
- This position comes with a competitive performance package
- The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

About Fundraise Up

Fundraise Up is a rapidly growing financial technology company headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, that provides online fundraising software to enterprise nonprofits. Fundraise Up's AI-powered platform is leveraged by trusted organizations like UNICEF USA, American Heart Association, Partners In Health, and Stand Up to Cancer, to double their recurring donor acquisition rates and increase overall digital donation revenue by two times.

About the Role

Join Fundraise Up as a Senior Product Marketing Manager and play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our product offerings and customer needs. Your mission will be to collaborate closely with diverse teams, including marketing, engineering, sales, and customer success, to ensure our solutions resonate deeply with the challenges and opportunities faced by our users.

Key Responsibilities
• Be responsible for developing product marketing briefs, messaging documents, competitive positioning, internal product training content, and external communication strategy for launches and in-market programs for existing and prospective customers.
• Constantly monitoring competitive activity, identifying customer needs and interacting with engineering, operations, and sales to bring innovative new products to market.
• Represent the voice of the customer across the organization. Amongst other deliverables, this manifests as differentiated messaging, positioning, and audience segmentation that is leveraged across the organization for internal and external use.
• Contribute to a customer reference program to curate and showcase customers' success across various industries and use cases.
• Possess expert knowledge of the competitive landscape. Develop and maintain sales tools and resources for the sales team to tell the story.
• Work with marketing team members across content, design, and web development to plan and execute new product launch campaigns.
• Collaborate with engineering to help align marketing priorities and programs with the product and business roadmap.

Skills and Qualifications

job_description:
Job Title: Marketing Manager Schools Segment

Salary: competitive

Location: Mexico City

Contract: Full time, Permanent

Join Cambridge to drive marketing campaigns of learning and assessment material for the Schools segment, establishing a constant dialogue with the educational community helping to achieve their goals and understanding their needs.

We are Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a world-leading academic publisher and assessment organisation and a proud part of the University of Cambridge.

About the role

We are looking for a Marketing Manager who will be responsible for developing and implementing fully integrated marketing campaigns that align with the marketing plan for the Schools sector, stand-out creatively, and engage target audiences. This manager will ensure Commercial teams are well equipped from a sales enablement perspective and collaborate closely with them to raise awareness and drive demand for Schools propositions

Key accountabilities of the role include:
• Build an understanding of customer needs and pain points, market challenges, opportunities, and competitor activities in the sub-sector to inform the development of campaigns and tactics that successfully engage target audiences and meet objectives.
• Create, implement, and continuously review a range of integrated marketing campaigns.
• Collaborate with Propositions colleagues to understand how campaigns and tactics should position relevant propositions via carefully crafted messages based on customer insights
• Work with Data & Channel excellence colleagues to optimise the execution of campaign delivery, continuously measuring results to inform and progress onward activity
• Liaise with sector Marketing and in-market Commercial colleagues to ensure relevant tools and training are in place to support the sales process
• Manage relationships with internal and external delivery partners to ensure campaigns and tactics are delivered on brand, on brief and on time, and that they clearly demonstrate return on marketing investment (ROMI)
• Collaborate with Propositions colleagues in conducting local research and pilots

About you

We seek a highly motivated Marketing Manager Adult Segment to join our Mexico and Central America Marketing team that has the following qualifications:

Essential knowledge/qualifications
• Educated to degree level or equivalent experience
• Knowledge and experience of English Language Learning and/or assessment marketing and customers
• Fluency in English

Essential skills
• Customer focussed
• Insights driven and results oriented
• Creative, innovative, and collaborative
• Project management skills
• Excellent communicator
• Excellent copy writing
• Relationship building skills
• Confident speaker and presenter
• Digitally literate with a solid understanding of the digital media mix

Essential Experience
• Experience in English Learning and/or Assessment in marketing communications or product marketing
• Leading on integrated marketing campaigns that have delivered commercial value

Rewards and benefits

We will support you to be at your best in work and to live well outside of it. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a world-class, flexible rewards package, featuring family-friendly and planet-friendly benefits.

We also offer flexible and hybrid working options from day one. We will consider any work arrangements if you wish to work flexibly or require adjustments due to a disability.

Ready to pursue potential? Apply now.

We review applications on an ongoing basis, with a closing date for all applications being 03 April 2024 and interviews are scheduled to take place w/c 08 April 2024

Please note that successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory background checks including DBS due to working in a regulated industry.

Why join us

Joining us is your opportunity to pursue potential. You'll belong to a collaborative team that's exploring new and better ways to serve students, teachers and researchers across the globe – for the benefit of individuals, society and the world. Sharing our mission will inspire your own growth, development and progress, in an environment which embraces difference, change and aspiration.

Cambridge University Press & Assessment is committed to being a place where anyone can enjoy a successful career, where everyone has a voice, and where we learn continuously to improve together. Ensuring that everyone feels they belong is essential to who we are, and to the contribution we make to society and our planet.

We believe better outcomes come through diversity of thought, background and approach. We welcome applications from people from all backgrounds and communities, actively seeking to employ people from a wide range of different communities

job_description:
About the role:

We are seeking a results-driven, relationship-building, and storytelling expert to launch our Customer Advocacy program for the Mexico region. As a Senior Customer Marketing Manager, you’ll uncover and bring to life industry-leading customer stories, build and nurture our regional customer base, help connect Samsarians to the right customer story for their go-to-market needs, and more. This program is mission-critical to increasing customer advocacy, loyalty, and retention to benefit Samsara’s long-term growth.

This is a highly collaborative role and will report to the Global Customer Marketing team in our US headquarters. You will be the first customer marketer hired in Mexico and will build and manage the customer marketing function for Samsara in the region, working closely with the regional marketing team.

You should apply if:
• You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
• You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role won’t be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
• You’re energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
• You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best.

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara.

In this role, you will:
• Programmatically uncover and tell our leading customer stories: Uncover and tell compelling customer stories about how our customers are transforming their operations with Samsara. You’ll be the voice of the customer, telling their stories via case studies, videos, and testimonials across samsara.com and more. You’ll drive the end-to-end creation of these stories from customer identification and nurturing the relationship to securing approvals for launch and story distribution, partnering with Content and Product Marketing along the way.
• Grow our customer logo and story library: Launch a user-friendly customer story and approved customer logo library for Mexico and enable teams such as Sales and Customer Success to use these resources to find the right story, quickly.
• Build relationships with customers: Build authentic customer relationships and become a customer expert. Understanding customer motivations, goals, blockers, and use cases and weaves this into your stories and customer programs.
• Drive key customer references for priority go-to-market initiatives: Identify and help customers hone and share their Samsara story at industry events, as a part of webinars or product launches, at our customer conference, and more.
• Support our Customer Conference: Work with teams across Samsara to support customer engagement and storytelling needs for our annual conference – everything from building relationships with customers to coaching customer speakers and supporting logistics to capturing stories at the conference.
• Mature internal and external processes and communication: Drive the creation of internal and external Customer Marketing processes to improve efficiency and unlock a positive customer experience.
• Develop and execute new programs and campaigns to meet the needs of the business: Spearhead and execute various new campaigns and programs to support GTM teams to meet the evolving needs of the business.
• Measure content and program effectiveness: Analyze content and program performance and independently optimize to improve impact.
• Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices.

Minimum requirements for the role:
• 5+ years of experience in customer advocacy, customer marketing, and/or marketing
• Fluent in English and Spanish
• Customer storytelling must be one of your superpowers; more specifically, you’ll need to be a business-savvy storyteller, able to deliver strong ‘no fluff’ content that still has human storytelling at the center
• Proven track record of building lasting authentic relationships with customers rather than transactional engagements
• Experience running customer video projects from start to finish; ability to actively coach customers to refine their stories
• Outstanding project management and organizational skills to complete tasks with high quality and on-deadline
• Strategic mindset with an ability to prioritize amidst many moving pieces, keeping the impact on business priorities top of mind
• A passion for serving and partnering with customers
• Ability to quickly get to the heart of a problem and solve it
• Cross-functional collaborator with strong listening skills rooted in empathy to develop authentic relationships
• Attention to detail and a commitment to exceptional work are part of your philosophy
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Results-driven with analytical chops to measure the effectiveness of advocacy programs
• Bachelor’s degree

An ideal candidate also has:
• Willingness to travel 25% of the time to customer sites and industry events across Mexico
• Experience working with logistics and transportation companies

Drive a bold and positive mindset and use all the previous background in pharma to propose on how to work better as a TEAM that WINS.

​

job_description:
Additional Locations: N/A

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.

Boston Scientific is a diverse company that is committed to empowering women, the LGBTQ+ community, and people with disabilities. We believe that diversity is a strength, and we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where all employees can thrive. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their background or identity.

We are looking for an energetic Regional Sales Manager to join our amazing team at Boston Scientific Corporation in Monterrey.

Position based in Monterrey, responsible for the territory in the Pacific and nearby cities (Chihuahua, Tijuana, Hermosillo, BC) / Willingness to travel 1-2 overnights a week

If you are strong in persuasion, and cooperation and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Regional Sales Manager at Boston Scientific Corporation today!

Purpose Statement

Work in line with corporate, regional and/or country sales strategies to plan, schedule and execute sales tactics in securing BSC product positioning, market penetration, training, and forecasting against market and sales plans. Reference marketing intelligence and research to properly strategize with sales team to capture and broaden BSC's market share. Aid the achievement of customer satisfaction and business growth through focused business planning and people management.

What we are looking for in you:

Basic Qualifications-
• 3+ years relevant business experience, at least 3 years direct sales experience is required.
• Bachelor’s degree is required.
• Documented sales success
• Trainings on People management, Business, Marketing
• High skills in data analysis, people management and business administration
• The candidate must have results driven, high flexibility and strategic thinking skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Proven analytical, planning and negotiation skills, as well as strategic thinking.
• High degree of initiative and creativity with the ability to meet deadlines and work with minimal supervision
• Coordinates with the back-office team (Customer Service, Operations, Marketing, Finance etc.) to resolve customer and sales team requests.

Preferred Qualifications-
• Advanced degree MBA
• Medical device experience and/or urology/endoscopy experience
• Sales management experience
• Experience with hospitals and in-office selling
• Ability to present value proposition incorporating both financial and clinical impacts
• Selling disruptive technologies
• Consultative based selling

Key Responsibilities:
• Manage and develop your assigned territory: Executes territory sales plans and strategy in line with the Business Unit Strategy to maintain and develop existing and acquire new customers.
• Develop and implement the sales strategy in the north of Mexico, this position requires 50% to 60% of travel.
• Develop and deepen key customer relationships: Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals.
• Build strong business relations between KOL´s KDM´s and Channel partners to develop new business opportunities and create “patient centric” concept.
• Industry Knowledge: Responsible for providing continuous tools and education to group members to ensure up to date industry, competitor and product knowledge; Maintains knowledge of the industry and the competition continually seeking information from physicians, suppliers, and others to challenge, modify and prioritize regional strategies; Collects data from their region on competitor's sales tactics and prepares their team to counter them and keeps the marketing organization aware; Maintains awareness of industry trends and their impact on local/regional sales activities.
• Business Management: Monitors region sales performance on an ongoing basis, initiating corrective actions, preparing reports, summaries, analysis and documentation on all aspects of region management; Assists sales support/marketing staff members in activities such as sales promotion, training or market research in planning and executing special projects; Ensures the effective implementation of representative customer records, key contacts, reports and company policies; Develops and executes sales strategies and activities in conjunction with the Country Sales Manager; Plans and controls expenses to ensure sales objectives are met within budget; Integrates individual territory plans and account profiles into a broader regional sales plan and coaches sales team accordingly, in consultation with the Country Sales Manager; Prepares quarterly regional sales forecasts and participates in the determination of market potential and sales expense estimates.
• Sales Execution: Regularly travels out with each team member, at least 3 days per week, to ensure divisional strategies are fully implemented; Ensures effective territory management and account targeting is practiced in each territory; Conducts quarterly sales reviews with team and manager, adjusts strategies in accordance with Country requirements; Responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring a region targeting program; Shares personal selling experiences in a way that motivates others and teaches applicable skills; Strong selling skills in front of the customer with others present and without taking over the sales process; Coaches others in the field on a disciplined selling model; Identifies sales forecast gaps, submits corrective strategies and implements aggressive sales growth; Develops and recommends expansion analysis of new field territories; Identifies & recommends promotion programs and materials to help support the sales plan & strategy; Actively supports corporate/divisional selling initiatives by proactively assisting in the training and influencing their team.
• Clinical Excellence: Maintains the skills and knowledge to sell the entire product line to all applicable buying influences and can differentiates each product line against the competitor's products in front of the customer.
• Creative Economic and Value-Added Solutions: Identifies and develops working relationships with the economic buyer in their country/ regions key accounts; Facilitation of contract negotiations involving all products within the region; Creates a compete "bundle" of product and value-add services; Evaluates situations as they affect both the account/customer, as well as the country's overall business needs; Helps define negotiation parameters for tough economically constrained customer situations.
• Building and Maintaining Relationships: Maintains contact with major accounts and key relationships seeking to leverage profitable business ventures; Assist key customers in the creation, maintenance, expansion and startup of divisionally related educational courses and forums; Attend and participate in customer, company and industry sponsored forums and courses; Develop and maintain relationships with key BSC functional areas; Spends maximum time in the field with each sales representative to support their professional development needs and to maintain and develop strong relationships and understanding of the customer.
• Quality: Spends maximum time in the field with each sales representative to support their professional development needs and to maintain and develop strong relationships and understanding of the customer; As interface to Clients and Customer Service has direct responsibility to facilitate, share documents and process to identify, notify and ensure any complaint or problem are addressed, thereby demonstrating high commitment to Quality in all interactions and behaviors; Drive as needed to support and facilitate any field corrective action related his/her scope; Participates in driving quality awareness in every employee, while guiding the local organization towards improved performance and customer oriented initiatives; Co-ensures that employees are notified of all mandatory training and quality obligations with HR Manager - Tracks completion of mandatory training; Ensures that all products and advertisement have been through the appropriate approval processes, prior to sharing or publishing.

Requisition ID: 574211

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

You will leverage your skills in digital marketing, analytics, and creativity to identify growth opportunities, design and implement experiments and optimize marketing campaigns. - Optimize marketing campaigns based on performance metrics, such as conversion rates, click-through rates, and return on ad spend (ROAS), using data-driven insights to continuously improve results

Job Description:

The Brand Building & Credibility Manager is responsible for creating and delivering successful marketing strategy, brand experiences and innovation for our brands. Working closely with other multi-functional local stakeholders, the innovation team and key demand stakeholders (Sales, Customer marketing) to create and deploy strategies, brand plans and assets that ultimately lead to increased brand equity and accelerated growth.

What are we looking for?
• Is a key member of the Mexican local Marketing Community and a supportive member for the global team, collaborating with the other demand team members to secure success.
• Minimum Bachelor’s degree, ideally in Marketing, Business Administration or Communications.
• Proven track record of at least 5 years in brand management.
• Strategic thinking and ability to develop and execute comprehensive brand strategies that align with business objectives.
• Proven track of disruptive model implemented. Ie new process, business model.
• Proficient in market research, consumer insights analysis, and data-driven decision-making.
• Skilled communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and inspire stakeholders.
• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to connect, collaborate and influence others without direct authority.
• Strong learning agility and adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic global environment

What will be your key responsibilities?
• With the PEDIGREE® or WHISKAS® Head support the development and execution of global brand strategy that aligns with the company's overall vision and objectives.
• With the Brand Head develop the strategy based on global ‘brand building’ including brand compass, brand positioning, creative strategy, superior proposition strategy, visual brand identity, purpose & sustainability strategy.
• Oversee annual flywheel diagnostic and brand plans in collaboration with the key demand stakeholders to optimize and enhance brand’s growth strategy.
• Develop and propose pet parent segmentation for the brand and critical audiences to target.
• Develop and propose the moments that matter for the brand across the pet parent journey.
• With CMI oversee comprehensive market research and analysis to identify consumer insights, market trends, and competitive landscape providing insights and recommendations to the marketing head that inform the strategic choices on the brand.
• Develop winning branded innovation concepts to fuel the local DS1/DS2 pipeline among with PEDIGREE® and WHISKAS® Heads
• Collaborate and command cross-functional teams to develop and launch these new products/packs, ensuring brand consistency and differentiation (DS1/DS2)
• Develop business model proposal in partnership with key demand stakeholders and customer centricity perspective
• Demonstrate a strong partnership, cultivate strong international relationships and manage cultural diversity

What can you expect from Mars?
• Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
• Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
• Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
• An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Job Description

Due to the continued growth of our product-led growth online business, we are looking to hire a sales manager with experience in a high transaction Saas environment to help establish our first dedicated digital team. You'll be a success in this role if you have proven experience in working closely with your peers to manage, build and inspire a team to achieve daily, weekly and quarterly goals. As manager of a high-volume Zendesk’s digital sales team, you will lead highly visible, strategic efforts for Zendesk - your motivating nature and high attention to detail will be critical.

Responsibilities:

Job Description

Location: Mexico City / Mexico

We are seeking a Client Solutions Manager to join our dynamic team. This individual will play a pivotal role in assisting our clients in building and optimizing their email marketing programs. The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of technical expertise, client-facing skills, and a passion for delivering exceptional results.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate closely with clients to understand their business objectives and marketing goals.
• Utilize technical skills to analyze and manipulate data using SQL to drive actionable insights and optimizations.
• Develop and implement email marketing strategies, leveraging a deep understanding of email, push, and SMS channels.
• Communicate effectively with clients in both Spanish and English, ensuring clear understanding and alignment on project objectives and deliverables.
• Demonstrate a strong ability to grasp complex technical concepts and provide innovative solutions to client challenges.
• Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and exceptional attention to detail.
• Utilize analytical and problem-solving skills to identify client needs and tailor solutions to meet their specific requirements.

Qualifications:
• 3+ years of professional experience, preferably in marketing teams or client-facing roles.
• Proficiency working with data in SQL.
• Demonstrated experience with email marketing, push, or SMS campaigns.
• Excellent communication skills in both Spanish and English.
• Strong ability to understand technical concepts and effectively communicate them to non-technical stakeholders.
• Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.
• Analytical mindset with a proven track record of identifying customer needs and proposing tailored solutions.

Nice to haves:

Experience using ESPs such as Simon Data, Klaviyo, Braze, Customer.io, Salesforce, or HubSpot.

But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Data Operations Manager, Go-To-Market (GTM) Planning & Insights

Why we have a role: The Qualtrics GTM Planning & Insights team is looking for a senior data systems focused leader to grow our CDMX data operations/quality team and maintain an exceptional level of data quality within our go-to-market data sources. This role is essential to enabling our go-to-market operations and surfacing valuable insights to our field teams.

Things you'll do:
• Oversee maintenance of critical data sources, pipelines, mappings, and logic used by global go-to-market teams for the purposes of sales, customer success, and marketing operations. Create and update complex data queries, views, and reports.
• Establish processes to govern and improve data quality/accuracy/integrity. Proactively identify/flag/resolve issues. Conduct reporting and RCA on data quality.
• Act as ‘subject-matter-expert’ on key data sources and collaborate with analysts, field teams, and other stakeholders to ensure data is being used to drive business outcomes.
• Manage stakeholder relationships and understand a complex set of policies to work effectively with global teams
• Manage a team of analysts handling a high volume of projects and ticket-based requests

How you’ll grow:
• Opportunity to build a team from the ground up, including hiring/developing a team of analysts, creating new processes/standards from scratch, and establishing relationships with other leaders across the globe
• Deepen your expertise in data management, architecture, and operations. Learn how global sales, customer success, and marketing teams operate, and improve the data/systems/insights that drive their growth
• You will know you are doing an exceptional job when our data operations are running smoothly, analyst teams can reliably surface valuable insights, and global leaders trust you enough to come to you with their business pain points and ask for help.

How You’ll find success:
• Technical thought leader, with excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, and an eye for scalability, quality, and detail
• Natural people manager; able to coach, develop, and lead a team of analysts in a dynamic environment with wide variety of projects and inbound requests
• Exemplifies ownership of data operations and quality; able to lead initiatives from discovery phase through to implementation and ongoing process management
• Able to balance multiple stakeholders and priorities in a fast-paced environment, deal with ambiguity, and communicate effectively to a global audience

What We’re Looking For on Your Resume:
• Strong technical and data engineering skills
• 4+ years of demonstrated experience with databases, SQL, data integration/ETL tools, and/or languages like Python
• 2+ years of experience leading and developing teams of analysts
• Knowledge of data management and quality practices

job_description:
Embark on a voyage with Nautilus, Baja Expeditions and See Creatures, seasoned

pioneers of eco-adventure tourism with a legacy spanning half a century. Our story unfolds

amidst the azure waters and rugged landscapes of Baja, Mexico, where every journey is a

testament to our commitment to guest experience, luxury, and safety. From heart-pounding

encounters with majestic gray whales at San Ignacio to underwater dances with giant manta

rays at Socorro, our expeditions unveil the untamed beauty of the natural world in ways that

stir the soul and ignite the spirit of adventure.

Nautilus not only leads thrilling excursions but is also the creator of the Nautilus Lifeline

Marine Rescue GPS, a lifeline that has saved the lives of growing number of divers worldwide.

Role Overview

As the Marketing Manager for our company, you’ll play a crucial role in navigating the

digital landscape alongside our visionary founder. Your mission is clear, to leverage the power

of storytelling and community engagement to enhance our brand presence and foster

meaningful connections with our guests.

Through strategic social media management, you’ll craft compelling content that

resonates with our followers, inviting them to embark on immersive journeys with us. From

showcasing the thrill of exploration to fostering a sense of camaraderie among our online

community. your efforts will inspire curiosity and fuel the desire for authentic adventure. Join us

as we embark on this journey of growth and discovery, where each interaction brings us closer

to our goals in the dynamic realm of adventure tourism.

Responsibilities:

1. Branding Strategy: Collaborate with senior leadership to develop and refine our

branding strategy, ensuring it reflects our company’s values, objectives, and target

audience. Lead efforts to evolve and enhance our brand identity over time.

2

2. Social Media Management: Drive our social media presence, developing engaging

content calendars, monitoring performance metrics, and fostering community

engagement. Stay abreast of emerging trends and best practices in social media

marketing to continually optimize our approach.

3. Content Creation and Management: Oversee the end-to-end content creation

process for diverse marketing channels, including websites, social media, newsletters,

blogs, reviews, videos, still imagery, Know Before You Go (KBYG) materials, and CRM

(reservations system) communications.

4. Second Stage Content Gatekeeper: Act as the primary steward of our brand voice,

content and messaging. Edit and refine content, including product descriptions and

other materials, to ensure accuracy, clarity, and alignment with brand guidelines.

5. Social Media Management: Drive our social media presence, developing engaging

content calendars, monitoring performance metrics, and fostering community

engagement. Stay abreast of emerging trends and best practices in social media

marketing to continually optimize our approach.

6. Website Optimization: Oversee the maintenance and optimization of our company

websites, ensuring they serve as effective hubs for information, engagement, and

conversion. Collaborate with web developers and designers to implement enhancements

and improvements.

7. Newsletter Campaigns: Develop and execute engaging newsletter campaigns that

inform, educate, and inspire our audience. Utilize segmentation and personalization

strategies to deliver targeted messaging and drive desired actions.

8. Content Distribution: Develop and implement strategies for maximizing the reach and

impact of our content, leveraging channels such as email marketing, SEO, paid

advertising, and influencer partnerships.

9. Performance Analysis: Monitor and analyze the performance of marketing initiatives,

using data-driven insights to assess effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and

inform future strategies.

3

10. Influencer Management: Cultivate and maintain relationships with relevant

influencers and brand ambassadors to amplify our message and reach new audiences.

Coordinate influencer campaigns and partnerships, ensuring alignment with brand

values and objectives.

11. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with the video production team,

including editors, shooters, and potential talent, to ensure the seamless creation and

delivery of high-quality video content aligned with brand objectives. Coordinate with

community managers to cultivate and engage our online community effectively.

Requirements:

 Proven working experience in social media marketing or as a Social Media Manager.

 Proficient consulting, writing, editing, presentation, and communication skills.

 Demonstrable social networking experience and social analytics tools knowledge.

 Adequate knowledge of web design, web development, CRO and SEO.

 Positive attitude, detail, and customer oriented with good multitasking and

organisational ability.

 Fluency in English.

 Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Communications, Business, New Media preferred.

Are you prepared to embark on a professional yet engaging journey where creativity flourishes

and every interaction propels us forward? If so, we invite you to join us at Nautilus, Baja

Expeditions and See Creatures. Together, let’s chart a course toward uncharted territories and

redefine the essence of eco-adventure tourism. Apply now!

Position type: Full time

Salary: $20,000.00 – $30,000.00 per month

Experience:
• Marketing: 1 year (Mandatory)

Language:
• English (Required)

Availability to travel:
• 50% (Mandatory)

Workplace: In-person employment

This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Mexico

About the Company:

Worldcoin (www.worldcoin.org) is an open-source protocol, supported by a global community of developers, individuals, economists and technologists committed to expanding participation in, and access to, the global economy. Its community is united around core beliefs in the inherent worth and equality of every individual, the right to personal privacy, and open and public collaboration. These beliefs are reflected in what the community is building: a public utility to connect everyone to the global economy.

The Worldcoin Foundation (www.worldcoin.foundation) is the protocol’s steward and will support and grow the Worldcoin community until it becomes self-sufficient. Tools for Humanity (www.toolsforhumanity.com) is a global hardware and software development company. It helped launch Worldcoin and continues to provide support to the Foundation, in addition to operating the World App.

This opportunity would be with Tools for Humanity.

Location: Mexico
About the Team:

The Market Operations team oversees the launch strategy and deployment of Worldcoin across all markets. This team deploys and manages all orbs worldwide and serves as the primary point of contact for local Operators. This team is responsible for effectively onboarding active users to Worldcoin. Overall, the Market Operations team is on the frontlines of Tools for Humanity’s ambitious mission of global, inclusive, and rapid distribution of the Worldcoin token.

The Market Operations team consists of three subteams 1) Expansion 2) Growth Operations and 3) Central Operations. The Expansion team is responsible for the market assessment, setup, and initial go-to-market. The Growth Operations team is responsible for ongoing management, partnerships, business development, and marketing within the region. The Central Operations team enables operational excellence by ensuring alignment across all markets and providing Support and global Operator communications. All subteams work cross-functionally with many other areas of the business to ensure the successful adoption and distribution of the Worldcoin token.
About the Opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced, highly motivated individual based in Mexico to drive user adoption as part of the Growth Operations team. Market Managers coordinate and support a network of local Operators and, ultimately, oversee the design and implementation of growth strategy and operations within their respective region.

Key Responsibilities:
• Build. Build and maintain relationships with Operators across your region. Provide motivation, advice, and support to the Operators in order to ensure optimal performance and hit regional growth goals.
• Strategize. Design and execute local growth strategy by analyzing internal data and market insights and leveraging local opportunities. Conduct market research and run data analysis to inform decision making.
• Strengthen. Continuously strive to improve Operator operations by strengthening internal processes and logistics, while providing feedback to relevant teams.
• Collaborate. Work cross-functionally with many teams, including Product and Economics, to ensure that Operators are incentivized properly and users stay engaged and contribute to further growth.
About You:
• You have 7+ years of relevant experience. You have succeeded in high-performance operations, business development, or sales roles in Mexico before.
• You’re scrappy. You enjoy working as part of a fast-moving, dynamic team and are willing to contribute wherever needed to make an impact.
• You have strong cross-cultural competency. You are able to communicate and do business across different cultures and countries and have experience working in cross-cultural environments.
• You have strong interpersonal skills. You are able to manage and nurture high-performing relationships with local Orb Operators in Mexico. You know that no two people are the same and are able to mediate and resolve conflicts.
• You’re innovative. You love coming up with solutions to unconventional problems and taking action.
• You’re analytical. You make data-driven decisions and are eager to contribute to larger strategy conversations.
• You’re based in Mexico, and are ready to travel. You have extensive experience living and working in Mexico, but are also able to spend 50-75% of your time on the road to drive growth in your region.

job_description:
Position Overview:Join us as a Marketing Producer in Mexico City!

You'll bring to life title marketing campaigns, creating unforgettable public experiences. Your diverse production experience and deep understanding of the Mexican market will be invaluable in our fast-paced, dynamic environment, just like every production environment in a high-performance company.

Who you are:A Marketing Production Manager is a resilient team player who thrives on change, is detail-oriented, and has a global business vision. You're comfortable working with all levels of the organization and understand the value of nurturing relationships with agencies and vendors. You're adaptable and ready to adjust workflows as necessary. You're passionate about executing ideas with a clear north star for success and always pursue operational excellence.

Key responsibilities:

Excellent Project Management skills
• Driving top-notch execution as an operational expert, bringing innovative campaign ideas to life.
• Acting as the guardian of excellence in execution, demonstrating craftsmanship and attention to detail.
• Ensuring that vendors involved in a project and stakeholders consistently meet their deadlines.
• Proactively troubleshooting, anticipating, and creatively solving problems in a timely manner during a production setup.
• Having a holistic point of view when working cross-functionally on each initiative from both creative and production perspectives.
• Jumping into conversations when needed to clarify project concerns with the team, vendors, or agencies.
• Sharing toolkits and available material with agencies as required.
• Collaborating effectively with various teams, ensuring deadlines are consistently met.

Local production expertise:
• Coordinating and overseeing a variety of production types like AV, experiential, digital, and traditional, among others.
• Developing bespoke production strategies for each campaign and offering tailored production solutions.
• Evaluating the technical feasibility according to the creative idea and identifying the best vendors for the projects.
• Selecting vendors, overseeing production paperwork, and managing budgets to ensure successful, feasible campaigns.
• Making sure that everything is produced in line with the vision and Netflix's creative and operational quality standards.

Solution-oriented and curious by nature:
• Thrive on change and use it to fuel creative solutions, maintaining the capacity to elevate production values and local impact even when facing unexpected challenges.
• Consistently look for ways to improve how we bring ideas to life, considering new tools, technologies, and trends.
• Maintain an open mindset, prioritizing ideas and finding ways to make things work, avoiding the mindset of "can't be done".
• Emphasize simplicity and efficiency in decision-making, always optimizing available resources.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
• Collaborate with other marketing producers, support agency onboarding, and advise on best practices.
• Cultivate strong relationships with top-tier agencies and vendors.

Requirements:
• 7+ years of diverse production experience, particularly in the creative industry (preferred in advertising/events).
• Proven experience in corporate environments, agencies, and/or brands.
• Budget management and a knack for bringing ideas to life.
• Comfortably handle at least two campaigns per month and six different types of campaigns per year.
• High tolerance for change and resilience in demanding, fast-paced environments.
• Passion for Entertainment, Design, local and worldwide pop culture, Technology, Arts, and Advertising.
• Impeccable record of cultivating diverse relationships with vendors, partners, agencies, and production companies.
• Committed to creating more inclusive and safe workspaces.
• Fluent in English.
• Familiar with digital experiences, virtual reality, or the metaverse (preferred not limited).

Netflix focuses on Digital Entertainment. Their company has offices in Los Gatos. They have a very large team that's 5000+ employees. To date, Netflix has raised $3.102B of funding; their latest round was closed on April 2018.

You can view their website at https://www.netflix.com/in/ or find them on LinkedIn.

Extenteam is currently looking for a Remote Marketing Manager (Lead Generation - SaaS) to join our growing organization and undertake the following tasks:

Position Overview:

As the Marketing Manager (Lead Generation), you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's growth through

the development and execution of marketing initiatives. Your primary focus will be on creating and implementing

lead generation campaigns, utilizing a mix of digital and traditional marketing channels. This role requires a

creative and data-driven professional who can develop and optimize campaigns to attract and convert potential

customers.

Key Responsibilities:

 Develop and execute comprehensive lead generation strategies to drive customer acquisition and revenue

growth.

 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand product offerings, target audience, and market

positioning.

 Create and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email marketing, content marketing, social

media, and other relevant channels.

 Analyze campaign performance metrics and implement data-driven optimizations to maximize results.

 Conduct market research to identify trends, competitor activities, and opportunities for innovation.

 Build and maintain a strong sales funnel by generating high-quality leads and nurturing them through various

stages.

 Collaborate with the sales team to align marketing efforts with sales objectives and contribute to the

achievement of revenue targets.

 Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices to ensure our marketing strategies remain effective and

competitive.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.

 Proven experience as a Marketing Manager with a focus on lead generation in the SaaS industry.

 Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and technologies.

 Demonstrated success in developing and executing successful lead generation campaigns.

job_description:
Before jumping in on all the information about the role and what you can bring to the table, let us introduce ourselves real quick.

About us

Hi there! We are Insider, a B2B SaaS company that drives growth for its clients around the world. How are we achieving this? We are connecting data across channels, predicting future behavior with AI, and individualizing experiences from a single platform with the fastest time to value.

We announced that we unlocked our unicorn status after our Series D round. We are backed by top-notch investors including Sequoia Capital, QIA, Riverwood, Endeavor Catalyst and trusted by 1000+ brands from high-growth startups to the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies such as Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Nestle, Nissan, Samsung, Lenovo, Puma, MediaMarkt, IKEA, Allianz, Santander, Dominos, Avon, CNN, and the list goes on.

We are the #1 Leader everywhere! We are recognized as a leader in The Forrester Wave™ for Cross-Channel Campaign Management in Q3, 2021. We are also named a leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Personalization Engines. But wait, there is more. For 21 quarters in a row, we’ve been ranked as a leader in G2 Mobile Marketing, Personalization, Customer Data Platform, and Customer Journey Analytics Grids.

We are also proud to become one of the very few female-led B2B SaaS unicorns in the world.

Behind all these achievements, there is an exceptionally talented and passionate team across 28 countries that moves fast and agile, creates cutting-edge products, and focuses on making an impact. If you want to join us in this journey, just keep reading.

First things first: What is this role about?We are Insider, the world’s first Integrated Growth Management Platform that is loved by marketers crafting experiences for the world’s most renowned enterprise brands. We help enterprise brands connect customer data across channels, predict future behaviour with AI and individualise experiences.We are expanding our Marketing nation across 25 countries and we are currently for our Marketing Manager, Mexico & Spanish Speaking Latam. If you are a self-starter who has a passion for B2B Marketing and if you interested in building up the market presence of a unicorn SaaS company in the biggest market in the world, if you are up for the challenge of your lifetime, this is probably the role for you. Come and join our dynamic Marketing team to create your own playground and take our Spanish Speaking Latam marketing strategy to the next level. Read on if you want to discover how it feels to become one of us.You’re probably expecting an eye-catching, mesmerising job description that will sweep you off your feet, flavoured with the coolest startup jargons. After all, we’re a Sequoia and Riverwood-backed company, with an awarded woman CEO and a team across the globe that takes the word “diversity” very seriously. But that’s exactly why we think that nothing says more than the real experience. We’re underdogs who believe in the power of actions more than anything else. So we asked our VPs of Marketing, Regional Marketing Managers, Country Managers, and Sales Teams to tell us what they would expect from our Marketing Manager, Mexico & Spanish Speaking Latam and this is what they told us.

Day in and day out of a Marketing Manager, Mexico & Spanish Speaking Latam at Insider:
• builds and owns the marketing strategy and execution for Mexico & Spanish Speaking Latam, working closely with the global marketing team, your local team of marketing specialists, and the local sales team, to increase awareness, drive engagement, generate leads, and support conversion rates,manages all local marketing activities: demand generation, ABM, events, customer marketing, web, content, and PR,owns the event marketing program calendars, organising both Insiders events and industry events, managing all aspects of the projects from speakers recruitment to logistics,creates locally relevant assets to aid with sales and campaigns - case studies, whitepapers, guides,works closely with sales to measure program performance and lead quality

What we expect from you
• a Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing or a related field,
• +3 years of previous experience in B2B marketing, ideally for a SaaS business,
• solid leadership skills with experience in building and managing teams.
• Good knowledge of digital space,
• Experience using marketing automation and CRM tools (e.g. Hubspot, Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, Salesforce)
• Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to create and pitch compelling marketing materials
• strong creative problem-solving skills,
• extraordinary attention to detail,
• excellent event planning and execution skills,
• the ability to maintain a positive attitude,
• Fluent in English and Spanish

We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.

Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, and Medium!

Our client is a leading accounting firm committed to delivering innovative accounting, tax, and wealth management solutions and strategic advice to its diverse client base. As part of their ongoing growth, they are seeking a visionary Marketing Manager to spearhead their marketing efforts.

This role is ideal for a strategist with a comprehensive understanding of marketing principles, capable of leading and inspiring a team of creatives to execute marketing strategies and campaigns that drive growth, enhance brand recognition, and increase client conversion. The ideal candidate is a marketing generalist with experience in overseeing various marketing functions, from strategy development to campaign execution, without the need to directly handle creative tasks themselves.

Location: Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities:
• Marketing Strategy Development: Formulate comprehensive marketing strategies that align with the firm’s goals and client needs, focusing on the 3 primary services offerings within the financial sector's unique aspects.
• Team Leadership and Collaboration: Lead a team of creatives, including designers, copywriters, and social media experts, providing clear briefs, direction, and ensuring the execution aligns with the overall marketing strategy.
• Campaign Management: Oversee the development and execution of marketing campaigns, ensuring they meet objectives, are delivered on time, and within budget. Work closely with the creative team to ensure content is compelling, accurate, and effectively communicates the firm's value proposition.
• Quality Control: Ensure all marketing materials and content uphold the firm’s standards for accuracy, professionalism, and effectiveness. Regularly review and provide feedback on marketing assets to maintain high-quality output.
• Market Analysis: Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, opportunities, and challenges within the financial sector. Use insights to inform strategy adjustments and innovative marketing approaches.
• Client Relations: Act as the liaison between the marketing team and clients or internal stakeholders, ensuring marketing efforts are closely aligned with client expectations and the firm’s service offerings.
• Vendor Relations: Manage vendor partnerships for outsourced marketing services (web development, SEO, Paid) and evaluate performance on a quarterly basis.

What Success Looks Like:
• You have developed and implemented marketing strategies that significantly contribute to the firm's growth, brand visibility, and client acquisition.
• Successfully led a team of creatives, fostering a collaborative environment where innovative ideas and strategies are executed effectively.
• Ensured the delivery of high-quality marketing materials that resonate with the target audience, driving engagement and conversions.
• Established a process for continuous market analysis, allowing the firm to adapt quickly to changes in the financial sector and maintain a competitive edge.
• Match our marketing effort and brand with the sales process across the firm.

Qualifications:
• Extensive experience in marketing strategy and team leadership within a relevant industry, preferably financial services or accounting.
• Have worked extensively with the sales team to coach, adjust, and execute the combined marketing and sales strategy for the firm.
• Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, providing clear direction and fostering a collaborative environment.
• Strong understanding of various marketing channels and tactics, with the ability to guide creative teams in producing effective marketing assets.
• Excellent communication and project management skills, with a knack for ensuring projects meet strategic goals, timelines, and budgets.
• A proactive approach to market analysis and strategy adaptation, ensuring the firm’s marketing efforts are always ahead of the curve.

Application Process:

• Fill in the application form
• Record a video showcasing your skill sets

This position offers an exceptional opportunity to lead the marketing efforts of a reputable accounting firm, driving strategic initiatives that make a tangible impact on the firm's success. If you are a strategic thinker with a broad marketing skill set and a passion for leading teams to achieve outstanding results, we encourage you to apply.

Application Process:

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means working in an innovative, tech-driven and highly collaborative team environment supported by over 58,000 professionals in 60 countries across the globe.
