job_description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Senior Specialist, Marketing Campaign Operations

Why we have this role

Qualtrics is looking for a Marketing Campaign Operations Specialist to join the Global Marketing Operations team. This person will work with global business stakeholders, Demand Generation partners, and our field marketing leads to launch and track the success of our marketing campaigns. This person will ensure that incoming requests are complete, meet standardized criteria, and are optimized for our global demand generation standards - ensuring all marketing campaigns are QA’ed and launched on time.

How you’ll find success

The ideal Marketing Campaign Operations specialist is a dynamic and detail-oriented marketer who can learn quickly, drive projects independently, and fuel this fast-paced growth. This individual will also learn from and work with fellow Marketing Operations team members to help create scalable processes that ensure best practices in lead generation, lead routing, funnel management, and revenue attribution.

Things you’ll do
• Support Marketing Campaign Operations through templatized programs that include attribution, lead flow, landing page development, operational email, and project management elements
• Administer Marketo programs, working with the campaign teams to structure programs and ensure operational efficiency at scale.
• Monitor and maintain data quality within the marketing database, ensuring accuracy.
• Monitor the lead lifecycle of campaign members of campaigns globally - measure, and monitor record funnel from inquiry to MQL to closed won opportunity.
• Collaborate with marketing teams, analytics, field marketers and sales stakeholders to determine and evolve marketing automation best practices.
• Analyze campaign results and optimize to increase engagement, lead quality, conversion rates, program performance and the effectiveness of marketing spend.

What we’re looking for on your resume
• Proven track record in a fast-paced environment and organizational skills to manage multiple projects with flawless execution, delivering under a tight deadline
• A high degree of initiative, self-motivation and resourcefulness.
• Strong analytical skills and experience with actionable reporting for stakeholders
• Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes.
• High aptitude to learn and adopt new applications to generate results
• Experience in campaign creation, webpage development, lead management and/or working with sales team
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree from selective university
• 1-3 years of hands-on experience in B2B Marketing Operations and Marketing Automation Platforms (Marketo, Eloqua preferred)
• Proficiency with Marketo and Marketo Certification preferred
• Proficiency with Salesforce.com preferred
• Familiarity with Wordpress.com and Acquia/Drupal preferred

The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model: Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.
​​​​​​​
Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.

Qualtrics Work Experience - As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.

Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.

job_description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Manager - Dermatology Portfolio

Responsibilities:

As the Dermatology Brand Manager you will play a critical role in achieving the successful launch of 2 important indications in the near future and building/strengthening Eli Lilly presence with the Dermatologists community in Mexico. You will be responsible for achieving our sales targets and desired market position in launch year.

You will work closely with the cross functional team to lead the development and implementation of our brand strategy and tactics.

You will also work and communicate with Global and LATAM teams; the different affiliate departments and with key external customers to align the strategic and tactical direction of your brand projects with the overall brand strategy.

Your key responsibilities will be leading a multi-channel strategy, partnering in the development of the customer plan and business plan, and developing and implementing marketing tactics consistent with the overall brand strategy; You will also be responsible for managing expense budgets related to your specific projects, and other responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor´s degree
• 1+ years of marketing experience as a Brand Manager
• Experience as a Sales Rep (highly desirable)
• Understanding and experience of strategic planning (customer insights and patient journey, patient flow, segmentation, positioning, branding, messaging, results monitoring).
• Proven cross-functional partnering capabilities, particularly with Sales, Medical and Commercial teams.
• Proven ability in building strong business relationships with Key Opinion Leaders in the industry.
• Technical marketing competencies in key areas related to MCE –brand positioning/strategy/creative campaigns, segmentation, messaging/content strategy, channel mix, creating and running multi-channel executional campaigns, marketing mix measurement, marketing operations.
• Business Case and Alternative Access Programs design and development.
• Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills in Spanish and English.
• Proficient computer skills (teams, excel, word and PowerPoint)
• Analytical skills / strategic thinking

Additional Skills/Preferences:
• Experience as a District Sales Manager.
• Clear understanding of the promotional rules of engagement and how we communicate with our customers in Mexico.
• Experience leading a new or recently launched brand.

Competencies, Skills and Required Knowledge:
• Leadership: Proven Ability to partner with and lead others towards a common goal (particularly in cross-functional collaboration, decision making and leading without authority).
• Experimentation and Risk Taking: Proven track record of pursuing non-conventional ways to meet customer needs and enhance the customer experience.
• Project Management: Ability to manage detailed, complex projects.
• Business acumen skills: Budget management, strategic tradeoffs, development, and monitoring of lead measures.
• Strategic thinking and commercial acumen.
• Ability to thrive in a high pressure and ambiguous environment.
• A demonstrated ability to develop strategic plans from vision to implementation with success.

job_description:
Company Description

At Jellyfish, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives and inclusive collaboration. We welcome individuals who excel in collaborative, varied teams and value the unique contributions that each person brings to the table.

Jellyfish is a unique fusion of tech enthusiasts, creative minds, and data experts, all united to empower brands in their digital journey. Our passion for innovation and commitment to embracing diverse perspectives are at the heart of what we do. We excel at challenging the status quo, reinventing marketing norms, and crafting influential stories that resonate with global audiences. Join us in shaping a future where business growth and personal fulfilment go hand in hand.

Job Description

The Senior Paid Search Manager will work with the companies appointed digital partner and take full accountability of the overall performance of paid search campaigns . These responsibilities are further broken down below:
• Basic to advanced implementation of campaigns on the different search engines in addition to performing or assisting in validation / audits on campaigns of the same team
• Measurement expertise on their platforms to identify poor implementations as well as areas of opportunity to improve campaign results.
• Participate in the development of sophisticated Paid Search media strategies which accurately address the objectives of the client and will enable us to achieve their goals and KPIs
• Ensuring that audits and research are properly utilized to deliver insight-driven/data-driven strategies
• Working closely with internal & Client Service teams to assist in the smooth implementation of work
• Attending and leading key campaign meetings (internal & client-facing) to represent the search team and provide support and actionable next steps when relevant
• Day to day management of digital media paid search campaigns, focusing on revenue and profit growth and managing within budget goals.
• Work in collaboration with other media channels.
• Build out logical and audience focused media plans.
• Optimise and execute on agreed methodologies against paid social plans, utilising native platforms, third party and internal tools, as required to deliver efficient and profitable Paid Search campaigns.
• Lead the campaign strategy, researching potential marketing channels, analysing competitors, and adopting a robust test & learn approach.
• Critically analyse the performance of campaigns, identifying strategic opportunities, facilitating change to hit and exceed the goals and KPIs set by the company.
• Project managing all activity and processes required to proficiently run and create campaigns.
• Produce reports and studies that clearly articulate the rationale for optimisation methodologies throughout campaigns.
• Maintain an in-depth understanding of the marketplace and social landscape to ensure delivery of best-in-class campaigns.
• Manage relationships with partners and communicate account strategy, budgets, and performance.
• Demonstrate measurable success through the achievement of set KPIs. e.g. account turnover and profitability, campaign management, report generation, analysis and, above all, strategic insights.
• Manage the day-to-day relationships with wider account teams, advertising partners and colleagues
• Upskill other members of the team, where required, on best practice paid search campaign execution.
• Support the wider team to improve their understanding of paid search.
• Share best practice and knowledge with wider teams via lunch and learns, or other learning opportunities..

Qualifications
• The ideal candidate will be detail orientated, quick to pick up new skills and calm under pressure.
• Minimum of 4 years of experience managing paid search accounts
• Certifications within Google Ads (Search, shopping, apps, display, video)
• PMax & GA4 knowledge
• Desirable SA360, Apps ( ACE & ACI) , Appsflyer

Note: We emphasise skills, expertise and behavioural attributes over years of experience and traditional degrees. If you want to join our collaborative team, we invite you to apply today with your resume in English.

Additional Information

Join Jellyfish and experience a workplace where we prioritise your growth, celebrate your contributions, and empower you to tailor your work environment to suit your needs.

   Reward: You'll receive a loyalty salary increase on your Jellyfish anniversary, in addition to our company-wide annual bonus.

   Custom Work Environment: Work remotely for up to 60% of your days and shape your day between 8am. and 6:30pm with flexible working hours.

   Growth, Your Way: Grow your career with one paid day each month for self-development and access to LinkedIn Learning with unlimited online courses.

   Health Insurance: We provide a private health insurance policy that includes visual and dental plan coverage.

Unfortunately, there has been an increase in fake recruiters impersonating Jellyfish and unlawfully using our brand name. Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

As a Service Sales Manager for Channels, you will ensure successful implementation of the service sales strategy for channels, distributors and service value providers for Drives, Motors and Generators, to profitably achieve qualitative and quantitative targets related to Life Cycle Management (LCM) and service products and solutions.
This is a position with global grade

12
This position reports to

Service Manager
Your responsibilities
• Creates, plans, and implements service sales strategy by increasing the Installed Base (IB) penetration through effective utilization of IB database.
• Promotes value add service product offerings supporting LCM.
• Achieves service sales volume by ensuring the service value providers sells entire service portfolio.
• Participates in development of business plan for channels.

• Analyzes service market potential with complete focus on IB penetration and ensures proper customer relationship management.
• Establishes long-term relationships with key channels and service value providers by understanding their requirements and relevant regulations and by exhibiting high level of expertise in technical solutions and products.
• Monitors client’s financial status and reports any changes regarding risk to relevant internal partner teams.

Your background
• Bachelor's Degree completed.
• Five years of Channel sales experience is needed.
• Experience in developing business plans for channels in the mining, F&B, Metals, Water, O&G industries.
• Knowledge of products and services (Motors and drives) is a plus.
• A previous experience working in the service area is desirable.
• Ability to travel.
• Proven leadership skills, with a collaborative, solution-focused approach and strong written and spoken communication skills.
• Advanced English is needed.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

job_description:
Job Description:

As a leading global Pet Nutrition company, Mars is at the forefront of continuing to better meet the needs and desires of pet and pet parents, and deliver on our purpose to Make the World a Better Place for Pets. An effective and agile portfolio strategy is a key component of accomplishing that. This role is a senior member of the team that is responsible for formulating and bringing to life that strategy.

What will be your key responsibilities?

Insight generation:
• Periodically conduct (in partnership with CMI – our insights org – and other functions) rigorous and insightful pet parent research around the globe
• Use that research to continually evolve and improve a pet parent centric view of the market – what pet parent need based demand spaces exist where, how we expect those spaces to grow and why, etc.

Global strategy formulation:
• Based on our view of the market, understand where brands and propositions play, articulate where we want them to play over time and why, and our reason to believe they can
• Recommend what opportunities should be at the top of our priority list, and help facilitate important and difficult trade-off decisions
• Sequence priorities to balance resource availability and management bandwidth with financial goals

Market strategy formulation:
• Work with individual markets on their market specific portfolio strategy.
• ‘Where to play’ (e.g., desirability of different pockets of demand / channels / etc., fit with our assets, size of prize)
• ‘How to win’ (i.e., high level shape of likely brand(s), product(s), R&D requirements, demand creation strategy, supply creation strategy, “by when”)

Execution:
• Serve as a key point of contact for the markets for thought partnership, problem solving, and barrier removal
• Partner closely with the finance organization so that our short, medium, and long term financial plans and ambition flow from our portfolio and brand strategy, and as we execute on inorganic opportunities
• Partner closely with our global innovation team as they play their role in bringing the strategy to life
• Establish and lead process for how we monitor performance against plan, periodically incorporate new external developments, periodically incorporate new internal ideas, and make big decisions

What are we looking for?
• Experience managing a wide range of stakeholders (including very senior) and collaborating to drive to the right answer without always having direct authority
• Strategy generation experience
• CPG marketing experience, with understanding of consumer insight generation
• Material people leadership experience
• Experience in a global environment preferred
• Strong change management skills
• Working effectively in a part-time virtual environment

What can you expect from Mars?
• Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
• Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
• Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
• An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

job_description:
Job Summary:

The Email Marketing Manager at Joorney will own the strategy, delivery, and technical setup of all email communications. We're looking for an experienced marketer who understands the immense value of the email channel and is able to build a growth engine around this form of communication.

You will have an opportunity to make a strong impact on the company, work with talented and passionate teammates, and build the best email marketing tool stack possible.

You will own the yearly strategy and delivery for commercial email campaigns to both B2C and B2B audiences. You will develop our overall CRM strategy (we use HubSpot), making sure we utilize all useful features that increase our efficiency. You will be a guardian of quality and volume, ensuring our audiences are not overwhelmed with irrelevant communications and do not receive too many emails. You will support the growth and setup of our community newsletter (we use Beehiiv). Finally, you will work closely with other passionate folks in marketing and other teams: content marketers, performance marketing and analytics managers, community managers, graphic designers, data specialists, and many more.

Key Responsibilities:
• Plan, develop, and execute email marketing campaigns in alignment with marketing strategies and goals.
• Utilize HubSpot's email marketing features to create, schedule, and deploy targeted email campaigns to segmented audiences.
• Ensure emails are optimized for deliverability, engagement, and conversion.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams including marketing, sales, community, and data teams to gather content, assets, and ideas for email campaigns.
• Collaborate with the Community Director on Joorney's community newsletter.
• Work closely with the content team to ensure email content is aligned with overall messaging and branding guidelines.
• Utilize data and analytics to segment email lists based on demographics, behavior, and other relevant criteria.
• Monitor email performance metrics such as open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and overall campaign effectiveness.
• Conduct A/B tests to optimize subject lines, email content, layouts, and calls-to-action.
• Provide regular reports and analysis on email campaign performance and actionable insights for improvement.
• Stay informed about email marketing regulations and best practices to ensure compliance with relevant laws (e.g. GDPR, CAN-SPAM, Google Email Updates).
• Work with the Data team to ensure seamless integration between HubSpot and other systems.
• Implement marketing automation workflows to nurture leads, drive conversions, and improve overall efficiency.

Qualifications and Requirements:
• Years of experience: 4+
• Areas of experience: email marketing, CRM management, B2B & B2C marketing, content marketing, conversion rate optimization, community building, email deliverability, audience research and segmenting
• Language proficiency: Fluent in English, with good writing and editing skills

Key Competencies:
• Growth mindset
• Creativity
• Teamwork
• Communication
• Adaptability
• Cultural Sensitivity

The Opportunity

QuidelOrtho unites the strengths of Quidel Corporation and Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, creating a world-leading in vitro diagnostics company with award-winning expertise in immunoassay and molecular testing, clinical chemistry and transfusion medicine. We are more than 6,000 strong and do business in over 130 countries, providing answers with fast, accurate and consistent testing where and when they are needed most – home to hospital, lab to clinic.

Our culture puts our team members first and prioritizes actions that support happiness, inspiration and engagement. We strive to build meaningful connections with each other as we believe that employee happiness and business success are linked. Join us in our mission to transform the power of diagnostics into a healthier future for all.

As we continue to grow as QuidelOrtho, we are seeking a Government Sales Manager who is responsible of achieving a business liaison with Integrators, based on QuidelOrtho principles of ethics and compliance, and for analyzing the government business environment in which these are mainly developed, as well as making action plans, implementation and monitoring of current and potential bidding events, supporting the commercial pillars in Mexico to retain, grow and win business for QuidelOrtho.

The Responsibilities
• Diagnoses and identifies in the organizational structures of Integrators (current and potential) the critical managerial, decision making influencing and operational functions, and makes retention/growth plans for current business and potential wins.
• Makes plans and identifies areas of operational opportunity supported by the Sales force, and transmits them to the decision making and influencing management areas, which support the retention, development and growth of business with Integrators (current and potential).
• Participates in the annual sales operation plans (AOP), identifying government business where there are contract renewals (installed base of brand), as well as those government tenders that are renewed; and where we do not have presence, with plans and synergistic activities and promotion among the work teams involved, aimed at achieving our participation.
• Analyzes, develops and implements action plans in conjunction with the Marketing team for under developed or uncomplied accounts, leading with the Sales team the completion and measurement of the results of the required actions, in order to reverse trends and improve the performance of these Distributors.
• Participates proactively and effectively in meetings convened by functional areas in order to provide the necessary information and feedback to support the continuous improvement of processes and achievement of objectives.
• Expert knowledgeable of federal and state procurement laws that are of interest to the business, supporting the identification and analysis of bidding events together with the Bidding Coordinator, establishing levels of compliance and calculates the possibilities of retention or participation as appropriate.
• Promotes meetings within the Integrator's structures and work teams in order to increase the knowledge and values of QuidelOrtho products and services in them, and provides feedback to the Commercial teams on promotion and how to improve the brand image.
• Participates un Regional Sales Meetings to present government sales schemes that support the understanding of the government market in Mexico.
• Perform other work related duties as assigned.

The Individual
• University degree in Chemistry or a career related to the Healthcare area.
• At least 5 years of experience in sales and business development for government institutions.
• Experience in the IVD industry.
• Effective communication and presentations skills, listening and understanding customer requirements, management of strategic selling and SFDC; planning, organization and metrics management.
• Microsoft Office skills at an advanced level.
• Fluent English.
• Availability to travel at least one week per month.

ACKNOWLEDGING THE POWER OF DIVERSITY

BRP is dedicated to nurturing a culture that invites, connects, and propels the ambitions of people of all backgrounds, profiles, beliefs and experiences. Ultimately, the diversity and uniqueness of our people fuel our ingenuity and set the course for the path ahead!

For this reason, we value diversity and we strive to always push each other forward to build an inclusive workplace where every employee feels like they belong, where they can grow and find meaning..

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 23,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey..

www.brp.com

POSITION OBJECTIVE
• The District Sales Manager ensures that the local market needs are properly fed back to the organization in order to ensure that these are reflected in the global business plan for the zone. The District Sales Manager works closely together with all departments of BRP CSC (Caribbean, South and Central America) in order to ensure both the efficient solution of problems as well as the proper implementation of the agreed business and action plans.

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Maintain and develop a profitable and strong business Distributor Network for all distributors of the division within the district.
• Develop and achieve commercial objectives and targets for UNITS and PA&A (Parts, Accessories and Apparel) for each of the markets the DSM is responsible for.
• Communicate the business plan objectives and priorities to the distributors and assist in the development of a local business plan which defines key objectives, priorities and critical factors for success for each of the assigned markets. Ensure that the local business plan objectives and market development strategy are in line with the global business plan and strategy for that country or region.
• Elaborate and ensure proper feedback to the organization through the RAP/DAP (Regional and Distributor Action Plans) and identify key priorities to develop each market. Work closely with and initiate the required actions from all departments to ensure the proper back up in order to ensure the realization of the business plan objectives.
• Promote and develop the proper use of OMS (order Management system) and other BRP processes and implement the Commercial policies in order to achieve and overpass the targets
• Support the Network Development area in researching and evaluating new distributors to develop the BRP business in new markets or to improve the business growth in existing markets. Support PMA definition considering commercial and market opportunities.
• Organize in conjunction with the Network Development team the in boarding processes to the new Dealers.
• Analyze and identify sales and marketing opportunities in order to optimize the efficiency of policies and propose budget allocations that leverage the marketing strategies and sales performances of BRP MD and the Dealers.
• Work closely with the Marketing team to ensure consistency with brand management guidelines, Product positioning strategy and value chain implementation, Dealer development guidelines, etc, while recognizing the specific characteristics of each individual market.
• Monitor distributor performance and progress during the Fiscal Year (FY) in order to ensure the realization of the business plan objectives and to propose corrective actions, if required. Monitor its commitment, performance and level of inventory.
• Participate in the development of the strategic business plan for the country or region in cooperation with the Regional Commercial Manager, Marketing Coordinator and other members of the management team.
• Development of Retail financing offer and coordination of seasonal promotions with the network.
• Raise “immediate” red flags in order to avoid credit issues, including inventory management, and support its resolution by promoting action plans to leverage cash generation and mitigating risks.
• In conjunction with the Distributor, Credit and Logistics teams coordinate and guarantee that the Products arrive in time in the markets.

Title:
Sales Manager, Latin America

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Sales Manager – LA is part of the sales team responsible for developing, implementing, and achieving the annual and quarterly Technology business sales plans for the Latin America Sales region.

POSITION RRESPONSIBILITIES:
• Works closely with members of the LA Sales Team and PSL leadership to develop strategic growth plans for the sale of Technology licenses and associated services in the region.
• Develops and maintains close alignment with other regional sales management or sales groups from other company businesses and affiliates.
• Identifies, creates, and manages key business relationships with senior management in client organizations and with company leadership in Technology and other business units.
• Responsible for implementing and developing strategic account management programs for technology clients ensuring that these programs are fully aligned with existing programs and standards.
• Complies with the company’s sales management process and systems for Technology Sales. Ensures compliance with current forecasting systems and works with sales management to determine improvements if any needed for technology related sales.
• Responsible for regional sales operations including sales forecasting, sales pipeline management, technology proposal management. Participates in the development of yearly regional strategic business development plan including regional competitor analysis and regional customer analytics to support Technology’s growth initiatives.
• Works with Marketing and other functions to understand regional installed base, market dynamics and trends as well as participates in developing market engagement strategies, market and tradeshow events and other associated activities to promote customer understanding of KBR’s technologies.
• Participates with all Technology Sales leadership in developing and maintaining consistencies across sales both with respect to customer interaction and with respect to internal systems, processes, and tools.
• Maintains behaviors from technology sales which aligns with overall Technology goals and objectives.
• Maintains full compliance with the company’s Code of Business Conduct. Maintains a safe working environment, ensuring compliance with all governmental regulations and corporate safety guidelines.
• Proactively participates in continuous improvement efforts in the areas of risk reduction and the elimination of potential hazards.
• Participates in bid and proposal activity, proposal prioritization and metrics, opportunity screening, sales forecasting, sales management and leadership, strategic account management, and management of regional sales activities.

REQUIREMENTS:

This role requires an individual who is a strong facilitator and negotiator, displays integrity and an open attitude, has strong communication and social skills at senior executive levels and is flexible and innovative; must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.

The candidate must be a proven sales performer with experience selling technology and / or engineering services to senior management levels in Latin America, particularly in Mexico.

This individual must have proven sales experience – strong ability to influence people by building trust and credibility.

• B.S. Chemical Engineer or related technical discipline, MBA preferred.
• Location: Mexico. Hybrid home office/presence.
• Knowledge of Mexican Refining/Petrochemical market preferred.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
• Bilingual in Spanish and English, both written and verbal; Portuguese a plus
• Willing to travel 25 – 40%

job_description:
We are ODILO: a fast-growing edtech company with a mission to democratize access to high-quality education and provide educational technology solutions to help our users reach their full potential.

Through our solutions, we provide access to millions of digital content items from the world's best providers and, using educational technology and Artificial Intelligence, we enable any organization to create its own unlimited learning ecosystem.

Currently, more than 4,500 institutions (governments, schools, libraries, universities, companies, and startups) place their trust in Odilo, providing access to their unlimited learning platforms to more than 170 million users in over 50 countries.

Our team is truly international (19+ nationalities) with the best talent across the education, media, content, and technology sectors.

As the Country Sales Manager Education, you will have a Director role reporting to the VP of Sales, and you will be fully responsible for our direct & indirect sales business in the Mexican market, and will become a key part of Odilo´s Education Vertical responsible for redefining Education institutions with the Unlimited Learning Category that Odilo is pioneering.

You will own our commercial efforts by leading our go-to-market, new sales, upselling, renewals and account management strategies, while strongly contributing to our marketing and product strategy for the Mexican Market in the Education Vertical.

To succeed in this role you will need to have strong leadership skills, a strong understanding of both managing complex deals with large private and public entities, and transactional deals with small organizations. Multi-stakeholder management, communications and leadership skills, as well as adapting easily to new scenarios and having a results-driven mentality are also a must for this role.

Our mission and vision: empower everyone to become the best version of themselves by allowing any organization to provide unlimited learning in the most frictionless, efficient and valuable way.

What you will do at ODILO:
• Develop a very ambitious sales plan to quickly amplify our sales coverage and hire the best local talent in Chile and Colombia and establish the commercial launch activities.
• Hire and develop our Sales team in the Education Vertical (Key Account Managers) in Chile and Colombia.
• Support your sales team in closing business in the education, smart cities, cultural spaces, and education and digital transformation organizations.
• Work towards surpassing our revenue plans.
• Analyze regional market dynamics and geo-political risks in an effort to maximize existing successes and create new sales growth opportunities.
• Directly contribute to the most relevant deals (+100K $) while creating and maintaining excellent relationships with our best customers and partners.
• As a Country Manager in the Education Vertical, you will become the biggest advocate of your market, working closely with Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, and Sales Enablement teams to define the customer segmentation and overall strategy and progress of your market and with the Marketing teams to define and execute the Marketing plan (lead generation, conferences, partnerships, etc).

What are we looking for?
• At least +6 years of total sales/consulting experience.
• Experience selling deals in the public administrations, government and comfortable working on a regular basis with C_level individuals for large education institutions.
• At least 5 years of experience selling large-volume deals directly in complex and sophisticated scenarios under MEDDIC or similar sales methodologies (SPIN, BANT, …), where consultative approach is essential
• Experience selling value added applications or Consulting Projects or learning programs with a strong technology component (Saas, Integrators of Technology, LMS systems, ERP, CRMs, Customized Technology development, etc).
• Experience creating a consultative selling approach with customer success at the forefront (i.e. The Challenger Customer), creating specific offers for each project
• You can demonstrate previous success adapting the sales playbook to manage a complex sales structure with different processes and sales cycles to accommodate different customer segmentations.
• Proven success executing go-to-market initiatives with a strong focus on outbound Sales and Account Based Sales.
• Ability to get involved in complex scenarios, with complex deals architecture, and work directly with prospects and customers when needed.
• Native Spanish Speaker and Intermediate level in English.
• Diligent in keeping sales related information accurate and up to date in company CRM.

What would make us happy:
• At least +12 years of total sales/consulting experience
• Previous experience in education strategic consulting projects.
• Previous experience working in the education or technological system integration industries.
• Experience working with big organizations or with the most important education institutions.
• Large experience building and growing sales teams.
• Experience training and leading teams (+3 individuals) with different profiles of KAMs.

Why ODILO?

Working at Odilo is about being part of a lifelong learning culture, where everyone has the possibility to take on challenges and participate in the growth of the company.

But we also offer:
• A fast moving and challenging job within a mission driven company in an international, creative, and ambitious work environment.
• Unlimited learning with Odilofy, our platform with more than 3 million contents in all formats (books, audiobooks, learning experiences, movies, courses...).
• A salary commensurate with track record and experience. (Compensation structure: 50% base - 50% variable).
• Real opportunities for internal professional development.

…And more!

Sounds like a mission made for you? Then we need to talk!
• ODILO is an entity committed to Diversity and Inclusion, which is why it accepts the presentation of candidatures without bias

Help us empower Mexico's ecommerce market while eliminating the pollution it goes with it.

As a Sales Business Manager, you will drive Eiya’s future growth engine by building relationships with prospective clients and lead them into happy users. You’ll manage inbound leads (as the first point of contact for many new and growing brands interested in Eiya's services) and follow up through the sales cycle. Most important, you’ll develop scalable strategies and repeatable processes that enable us to amplify the number of new brands joining Eiya.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Be the first point of contact to Eiya's potential customers. Drive results by providing solutions to the customer's logistics and online sales problems.
• Build and implement strong sales processes while growing your ability to inspire and motivate Eiya's vision into interested customers.
• Drive revenue growth by identifying and engaging new clients interested in improving their online sales backend logistics.

WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO HAS:
• 3+ years experience in sales, preferably in technology or ecommerce companies.
• Ability to develop and execute sales plans spanning multiple niches and industries.
• Strong presentation skills, particularly for in-person and online meetings with multiple stakeholders.
• Proven ability to lead complex negotiations.
• Strong customer solution qualities.
• Knowledge of the ecommerce and logistics industry.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Emotional intelligence and stability.
• An open mind to new ideas and approaches.
• Startup mentality: self-starter, proactive, flexible, fast moving.
• Self-learner traits.
• Long term vision.

EIYA OFFERS YOU:
• Competitive salary
• Base pay and negotiable commissions (applies only for sales teams)
• Compensation by law (Mexico Residents only)
• Educational tools and programs for continuous growth
• Maternal/Paternal paid absence
• 2 to 4 weeks of vacation per year

Join us!

..

We’re looking for good people to help us change and improve Mexico. We are hiring and looking for the right fit - both for you and for us. Do you want to make a difference? Want to work at a company where you're valued? Thrive in a culture that revolves around building amazing and engaging user experiences?

Eiya is a company that thrives on teamwork, innovation and an appreciation for detail. We are passionate and see life as an adventure.

Work with a highly focused global team that loves technology and supports one another every step of the way. We are on a mission to provide tools and services that build upon great architecture.

Our culture is simple. Work hard and why not have fun in the meantime. We only ask for simplicity, if you have emotional intelligence, strong written and verbal communication, ability to learn fast and apply, and a dedicated work ethic you will have a blast with us.

Eiya focuses on Consumer Goods, Logistics, Shipping, Ecommerce, and Smart Cities. Their company has offices in Mexico City. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Eiya has raised $500k of funding; their latest round was closed on October 2018.

You can view their website at http://eiya.mx or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

job_description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Why We Have This Role

The Global Acquisition Team is instrumental in propelling the worldwide expansion of our business. Leveraging digital platforms—including Paid Search, Paid Social, Content Syndication and our direct web channels—we aim to expand our customer base and provide tailored experiences that resonate with each local market. Partnering across the business our strategy focuses on harnessing the power of these digital avenues to meet the unique needs of our prospects and customers on a global scale.

How You’ll Find Success

This role requires a blend of creativity, analytical prowess, relationship building and technical knowledge to effectively manage campaigns and drive momentum in the business.
• Strategic Planning: Ability to develop comprehensive paid media strategies that align with the company's goals.
• Platform Expertise: Proficiency with paid media platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ad Manager, LinkedIn Advertising, and other social and search platforms.
• Budget Management: Skills to manage and allocate budgets effectively across campaigns to maximize ROI.
• Analytical Skills: Strong capability to analyze campaign performance data to inform future strategies and report on ROI.
• Ad Copywriting: Crafting locally compelling ad copy that resonates with the target audience and drives quality lead volume. .
• Creative Thinking: Developing creative concepts for campaigns that stand out and capture the attention of potential customers.
• A/B Testing: Running comparative tests on different ad elements to optimize performance and improve results.
• Knowledge of Targeting and Segmentation: Understanding how to segment audiences and target them effectively with personalized messaging.
• Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO): Skills to optimize landing pages and ad design to improve the rate at which clicks convert into desired actions.
• Ad Compliance: Knowledge of advertising regulations and compliance standards across different platforms and regions.
• Collaboration: Working with other teams, such as creative, localisation, sales development reps, and product campaigns teams, to ensure cohesive campaigns that support broader business objectives.
• Trend and Skill Self Awareness: Staying up-to-date with industry trends, platform updates, and best practices in paid media.

How You’ll Grow
• Mastery of Skill Set: We aim to develop the best talent in tech and drive to continuously learn new skills and platforms, such as mastering emerging ad technologies or getting certified in advanced features of existing platforms.
• Data-Driven Decisions: Enhancing your ability to make data-driven decisions by deepening your understanding of analytics, learning to interpret complex data sets, and staying up to date of the latest tools for data interpretation.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Seeking opportunities to collaborate globally with other departments, like sales development, content, field marketing, localization and product teams, to gain a more holistic view of the business strategy and understand how paid media fits into the larger picture.
• Industry Engagement: Attending webinars, workshops, and conferences to stay current with industry trends and network with peers. Test new ideas and strategies in your campaigns.
• Leadership Skills: We encourage leadership and taking the lead irrespective of your level at Qualtrics. You will have the opportunity to lead a cross functional pod, mentoring other team members, leading campaign strategies, or in the future managing a team.

Things You’ll Do
• Regional Acquisition Strategy: As a key member of the team develop and implement paid media strategies tailored to the specific needs and characteristics of each regional market.
• Budget Management: Allocating and managing the budget for paid media campaigns in the region, ensuring optimal spend for maximum ROI.
• Localized Content Creation: Working with the localization and creative teams to develop ad content and landing pages that resonate with the regional audience, including language and cultural nuances.
• Platform Management: Setting up and managing campaigns on various paid media platforms such as Google Ads, Bing, Facebook, and LinkedIn and regional website progression with a focus on the continuous progress of each region.
• Performance Analysis: Monitoring and analyzing the performance of campaigns, using regional data to optimize strategies and tactics.
• Audience Targeting and Segmentation: Identifying and targeting specific audience segments within the region, using demographic, psychographic, and behavioral data.
• Compliance and Localization: Ensuring that all campaigns comply with regional advertising laws and regulations and are appropriately localized.
• Collaboration and Reporting: Working closely with the SDR and Field teams and other Demand Gen teams ensure alignment of strategies and reporting on regional campaign performance.
• Market Research: Keeping abreast of regional market trends, consumer behaviors, and competitive landscape to inform and adjust paid media strategies.

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
• 2-3 years hands on Paid Media experience in particular in paid search campaign optimisation and budget pacing management
• Certified in Google Ads, Display, Video & Measurement
• LinkedIn Ads trained and certified
• A self starter who ideates and initiates actions and ideas
• A person who likes to work as part of a wider global team who thrives on collaboration

What You Should Know About This Team

Our team is truly global and made up of a hugely talented, fun and collaborative group. We are based across the global spanning locations such as Dublin, Tokyo, Sydney, Utah and Buenos Aires. In this role you will be supported and coached to make an impact!

Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits
• Focus Fridays - no meetings!
• Regular team bonding, including monthly happy hours
• Skip level and peer coaching
• Personalized training and development plans

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.
​​​​​​​
Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.

The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model: Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.
